issues.title: Fix IANA section for Mediatype registration
issues.author: dgpetrie
issues.body:
From David Dong
IANA Services Sr. Specialist:

1) Could you please add the registration template for application/vcon to the I-D? Please see Section 5.6 of RFC 6838 ([https:/ / datatracker. ietf. org/ doc/ rfc6838/](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc6838/) ).

If you have any questions, just let us know. If you'd like to talk in person, you can find us next to the RFC Editor's table from Monday through Thursday. You can also request another review at any time by contacting us at [iana@ iana. org](mailto:iana@iana.org).

For more information about IANA Considerations section requirements, please see

[https:/ / www. iana. org/ help/ protocol-registration](https://www.iana.org/help/protocol-registration)

issues.title: JWS vCon Header Object SHOULD contain uuid
issues.author: dgpetrie
issues.body: As a convenience to not requires base64url decoding of protected and then parsing JSON.

issues.title: unprotected object in JWE form of vCon should contain uuid
issues.author: dgpetrie

issues.title: application/vcon+json
issues.author: SteveLasker
issues.body: Referencing https://ietf-wg-vcon.github.io/draft-ietf-vcon-vcon-container/draft-ietf-vcon-vcon-container.html#section-5.3.1, should the content-type include json? `application/vcon+json`

issues.title: vcon or version to represent the version
issues.author: SteveLasker
issues.body:
https://ietf-wg-vcon.github.io/draft-ietf-vcon-vcon-container/draft-ietf-vcon-vcon-container.html#section-4.1.1 specifies:

> For syntax defined in this document, the string MUST have the value: "0.0.1"

When using the vcon, I was surprised to see the vcon property to be a version, rather than the vcon object.

I do appreciate we need a version to deliniate changes over the life of the draft and life post draft.

Rather than use the root object to represent a version, can a new `version` property be added?

Or, if that becomes confusing for the version of the vcon content, as opposed to the schema version, perhaps `schema-version`, or `spec-version`

comments.author: dgpetrie
comments.body: I do not disagree with your suggestion, but I think this ship has sailed.  The point of the version number is to provide a migration indicator.  I do not want to have a migration strategy for the migration indicator.  The current approach is not without precedent. HTTP and SIP both have a version number that is only identified by the protocol label that precedes it.

comments.author: SteveLasker
comments.body: Stability is certainly a key issue. However, the draft is still in it's early stages, only in version 02. Isn't this is a good time to do cleanup for the long life we hope to expect?

issues.title: Attachment Object should reference dialog index
issues.author: dgpetrie
issues.body: Need a dialog property in Attachment Object to refer to the dialog in which it was presented/issues

issues.title: Register vcon:// uri
issues.author: SteveLasker
issues.body:
As we start deploying production vCon solutions with vCons and SCITT, we're using the vCon UUID as the correlation identifier.
In SCITT, weve started setting the `subject` to `vcon://` + `vcon-uuid` creating a unique identifier, scoped to vCons.

Proposing the registration of `vcon://` in the [iana URI registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/uri-schemes.xhtml) as provisional

issues.title: Add end-to-end session ID to dialog
issues.author: dgpetrie

comments.author: dgpetrie
comments.body: The point of this is to make it easier for constructing vCons for email threads.  Having the message_id makes it easier to check if the message is already contained in the vCon and avoid duplicates or complex comparison.

issues.title: Remove inline vCons
issues.author: dgpetrie
issues.body: Per discussion at vCon WG meetings at IETF 120 and 121, remove the parameters for inline vCon in the group, appended and redacted Objects.  vCon will be reference only (uri and/or uuid) in these Objects.

issues.title: add vCon parameter style description
issues.author: dgpetrie
issues.body: part of vCon core or extension framework should describe parameter naming style (lower case with underscores)

issues.title: Add text talking about compressing before encrypting VCONs
issues.author: rohanmahy
issues.body: Most uses of VCONs will benefit from compression. When a VCON is encrypted, it should be compressed before it is JWE Encrypted.

pulls.title: Pull in CC-use case and CDDL edits
pulls.author: dgpetrie

pulls.title: Markdown nit and spelling fixes
pulls.author: SteveLasker
pulls.body:
A bunch of consistency, markdown and itef tooling fixes to reduce the errors and warnings. 
I've preserved the line wrapping with "  " at the end of the line where it seemed intended.

There are no draft changes in this pr, just formatting to make subsequent PRs easier to parse through the ietf tools.

There were several warnings for _"no link definitions for..."_, however I've left those in case those were reminders to reference.

comments.author: dgpetrie
comments.body:
Thank you for the spelling and formatting edits.  I have incorporated most of your edits in the current version of the draft.  

I am not sure what the benefit of using * vs - for bullets.  I have not made those changes.  Also what is the issue with blank line white space?  I find it useful in reading the raw markdown doc.

comments.author: SteveLasker
comments.body:
Thanks, @dgpetrie 
For the * vs -, and blank lines, the nits come from: https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/
Adding spaces between items confused markdown renderers to think these are separate lists.

pulls.title: Replace all occurrences of mimetype with mediatype
pulls.author: rohanmahy

pulls.title: Add support for Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) in Party Object
pulls.author: howethomas
pulls.body:
### did

If a Decentralized Identifier (DID) is known for the party, it can be included in the did parameter.

* did: "String" (optional)

The value of the did parameter MUST be a valid DID URI that enables verifiable, decentralized digital identity for the party. DIDs are designed to be decoupled from centralized registries and identity providers, allowing the controller of the DID to prove control without requiring permission from other parties. The DID can refer to any subject (person, organization, thing, etc.) as determined by the controller of the DID.

### Attaching DID Documents

An alternative approach to including DIDs in the Party Object is to add Attachment Objects containing the complete DID documents for each party. This approach provides more comprehensive identity information including cryptographic material, verification methods, and services that enable a DID controller to prove control. When using this approach:

1. Create an Attachment Object for each party's DID document
2. Set the mediatype to "application/did+json" (or appropriate mediatype)
3. Include a reference to the party in the attachment's party parameter
4. Consider adding a custom type/purpose indicator that this is a DID document

The DID document approach provides richer identity information that can be used for verification beyond simple identification.

pulls.title: Clarify vcon versioning approach
pulls.author: howethomas
pulls.body:
Adds to top level meta-data

vcon
The value of vcon parameter contains the syntactic version of the JSON format used in the vCon, following semantic versioning principles.

vcon: "String"

For syntax defined in this document, the string MUST have the value: "0.2.0"
The version follows the format "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH" where:

MAJOR version increments represent incompatible changes that break backward compatibility
MINOR version increments represent added functionality in a backward-compatible manner
PATCH version increments represent backward-compatible bug fixes

Implementations SHOULD reject processing a vCon with a MAJOR version higher than they support. Implementations SHOULD accept processing a vCon with the same MAJOR version but a higher MINOR or PATCH version than they were designed for, as these changes maintain backward compatibility.
